Module org.microbean.type
Package org.microbean.type

Class LowerBoundedWildcardType

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.type.LowerBoundedWildcardType
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constable, Type, WildcardType
public final class LowerBoundedWildcardType extends Object implements Constable
A WildcardType implementation that has only lower bounds.
Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:

    • LowerBoundedWildcardType

      public LowerBoundedWildcardType(WildcardType wildcardType)
      Creates a new LowerBoundedWildcardType.
      Parameters:
      wildcardType - the WildcardType whose lower bounds will be effectively copied; must not be null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if wildcardType is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if wildcardType has no lower bounds
      See Also:
      • WildcardType.getLowerBounds()

  • Method Details

    • describeConstable

    • of

      public static final LowerBoundedWildcardType of(WildcardType wildcardType)
      If the supplied WildcardType is a LowerBoundedWildcardType, returns it; otherwise creates a new LowerBoundedWildcardType with the supplied WildcardType's upper bounds and lower bounds and returns it.
      Parameters:
      wildcardType - the WildcardType to effectively copy (or return); must not be null
      Returns:
      a non-null LowerBoundedWildcardType
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if wildcardType is null
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in that it may return a new LowerBoundedWildcardType with each invocation).
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • getUpperBound

      @Convenience public final Type getUpperBound()
      Returns the sole upper bound of this AbstractWildcardType.

      Wildcard types as defined in the Java Language Specification may have exactly one upper bound. WildcardType permits permits many, for no good reason. This method makes it easier to get the sole upper bound of a wildcard type.

      Returns:
      the sole upper bound of this AbstractWildcardType; never null
      See Also:
      • WildcardType.getUpperBounds()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • getLowerBound

      @Convenience public final Type getLowerBound()
      Returns the sole lower bound of this AbstractWildcardType, if there is one, or null.

      Wildcard types as defined in the Java Language Specification may have zero or one lower bound. WildcardType permits permits many, for no good reason. This method makes it easier to get the sole lower bound of a wildcard type.

      Returns:
      the sole lower bound of this AbstractWildcardType, if there is one, or null
      See Also:
      • WildcardType.getLowerBounds()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method may return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
